intro: Lappula consanguinea var. cupuliformis, commonly known as the cup-shaped lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive cup-like inflorescence, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats. The leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are pale yellow with four petals.
